inputs.notes: Current price in HKD. Net debt calculated as Total Debt (12,233.0) - Cash (51,383.3) = -39,150.3 (net cash position). Shares outstanding represents ordinary shares; 1 ADS = 5 ordinary shares, so ~640M ADS equivalent.

historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: Equity CAGR significantly lower than FCF/EPS growth due to aggressive capital return program ($5B buyback + dividends). Revenue growth decelerated sharply from 11.6% (5yr) to 6.2% (3yr) reflecting gaming market maturity. Using conservative revenue CAGR as base given mature business and China macro headwinds.

base.rationale: Base case assumes modest acceleration from 6.2% recent growth driven by Marvel Rivals success, PC gaming momentum (85% YoY growth), and favorable regulatory environment. Growth decelerates toward mature 4% by Year 5 as gaming market saturates. FCF margin stable at 40% reflecting strong gaming gross margins (70%+) offset by R&D investment. WACC of 11% reflects Chinese tech risk premium (higher than US tech WACC of 9-10%) for regulatory and geopolitical risks.

bull.rationale: Bull case: Marvel Rivals achieves $1.36B revenue potential and validates global expansion strategy. PC gaming sustains 50%+ growth through 2027. AI competitive moat drives margin expansion to 42%+. International revenue grows from 20-30% to 40%+ of mix. China regulatory environment remains favorable with 1,600+ licenses in 2025. Where Winds Meet and Sea of Remnants successful globally. WACC reduced to 10% reflecting de-risked execution and lower geopolitical tensions.

bear.rationale: Bear case: China regulatory crackdown resumes (repeat of Dec 2023 crash). Marvel Rivals underperforms expectations and international expansion fails (studio closures continue). Competition from Tencent and emerging studios (miHoYo, Game Science) intensifies. Gaming market saturation accelerates with no growth by Year 5. Non-gaming diversification continues failing. US-China tensions escalate with ADR delisting. Margins compress to 37% from increased competition and marketing spend. WACC elevated to 13% for heightened regulatory and geopolitical risks.

base.notes: Intrinsic value converted to HKD at 1.115 exchange rate (typical RMB:HKD ratio)

bull.notes: Bull case assumes successful global expansion and sustained high margins

bear.notes: Bear case reflects regulatory crackdown and international expansion failure

base.notes: Entry price to achieve 15% CAGR to terminal value. Very close to current price suggests fair valuation at current levels.

sensitivity.notes: Sensitivity analysis shows intrinsic value ranges from RMB 173-381 (HKD 194-425) across WACC and terminal growth assumptions. Current price of HKD 206.60 is within the range, with upside in most scenarios.

probability_weighted.notes: Weighted toward base case given mature business profile and elevated China risks. 60% base, 20% bull (Marvel Rivals success potential), 20% bear (regulatory/geopolitical risks).

per_ads_valuation.notes: ADS valuation assumes RMB:USD rate of 7.26. NTES trading on NASDAQ around $130-145 range. Base case IV of $141 suggests modest upside for ADR investors.

current_valuation_metrics.notes: Trading closer to fair value vs peers. Tencent trades at 24-26x P/E. NetEase at ~22x P/E with similar growth profile and higher margins.

key_value_drivers: Marvel Rivals success: 40M players, $1.36B annual revenue potential validates global strategy
Net cash position: RMB 39.2B ($5.4B) provides financial flexibility for R&D, M&A, buybacks
Shareholder returns: $5B buyback program through 2029 with $3B remaining + 2.2% dividend yield
AI competitive moat: 5-year lead in AI integration drives 70%+ gaming gross margins
Evergreen franchises: Fantasy Westward Journey profitable after 22 years, reduces hit-driven risk
Regulatory improvement: 1,416 licenses in 2024 (+25%), projecting 1,600+ in 2025
key_risks: Regulatory uncertainty: Dec 2023 draft regulations crashed stock 28%; government maintains unpredictable control
International execution: Studio closures and scaling back Western investments show challenges
Competition: Tencent 2.4x larger; miHoYo and Game Science emerging as strong competitors
Gaming concentration: 82% of revenue from gaming creates single-industry dependency
Geopolitical risks: US-China tensions, ADR delisting threats (though mitigated by HK listing)
Non-gaming struggles: Cloud Music, Youdao, Innovative businesses all declining or weak growth
valuation_summary.investment_recommendation: NetEase appears modestly undervalued at current levels. Base case intrinsic value of HKD 228.63 (RMB 205.05) implies ~11% upside from current price of HKD 206.60. Probability-weighted IV of HKD 228.88 confirms modest upside. Entry price for 15% CAGR target is HKD 125.44, well below current levels. Bull case (HKD 330.57) offers 60% upside if international expansion succeeds. Bear case (HKD 144.15) implies 30% downside if regulatory risks materialize. Key catalysts include Marvel Rivals monetization, PC gaming momentum, and favorable China regulatory environment. Primary risks are regulatory crackdown and international expansion execution. Conservative 60/20/20 probability weighting reflects mature business with elevated China-specific risks.
